snippet.title: Cutting it close: Pa. man survives accident that put chainsaw into his neck
snippet.description:
* The calendar said March, but Monday clearly was Valentine's day -- James Valentine, to be specific -- when the 21-year-old Pennsylvania man survived a work accident that sent the razor-sharp teeth of a chainsaw blade deep into his neck and shoulder, and barely a centimeter from a vital artery.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/01/us/chainsaw-accident-survivor/index.html

snippet.title: In his last act, Iraq veteran's mission turns deeply personal
snippet.description:
* Tomas Young's life nearly ended nine years ago when he was riding in the back of a water truck in Baghdad's Sadr City. Two rounds from a sniper's AK-47 hit him; the first severed his spinal cord and the second shattered his left knee.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/04/14/us/anti-war-vet-suicide/index.html

snippet.title: Radiation regenerates spinal cord in rats
snippet.description:
* NEW YORK CNN Four to five months after researchers severed its spinal cord, one laboratory rat exhibits the expected result splayed rear legs and a complete lack of muscle control beyond the point where the cord was cut.
http://www.cnn.com/HEALTH/9609/30/nfm/spinal.cord/index.html

snippet.title: FDA approves human embryonic stem cell study
snippet.description:
* Federal regulators have cleared the way for the first human trials of human embryonic stem-cell research, authorizing researchers to test whether the cells are safe to use in spinal injury patients, the company behind the trials announced Friday.
http://www.cnn.com/2009/HEALTH/01/23/stem.cell/index.html

snippet.title: Steroid proving effective after spinal injuries
snippet.description:
* PITTSBURGH CNN David Thomas wheels into work, nearly a year after a common summertime accident his ladder slipped.
http://www.cnn.com/HEALTH/9705/27/nfm.paralysis/index.html

snippet.title: Doctor accused of severing babies' spines with scissors in 'house of horrors'
snippet.description:
* A Pennsylvania doctor is accused of running a "house of horrors" in which he performed abortions past the 24-week limit allowed by law -- even allegedly as late as eight months into pregnancy.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/03/04/us/pennsylvania-gosnell-trial/index.html

snippet.title: Philadelphia doctor accused of murdering patient, newborns
snippet.description:
* Allegedly running what the prosecutor calls "a house of horrors," a Philadelphia physician, Kermit Barron Gosnell, was charged Wednesday with murder and other offenses related to illegal, late-term abortions.
http://www.cnn.com/2011/CRIME/01/19/pennsylvania.abortion.doctor/index.html

snippet.title: Doctor accused of severing babies' spines
snippet.description:
* he Hippocratic Oath, when properly translated, doesn't actually say, "First, do no harm." But since the time of the ancient Greeks, that's become the mantra for every medical professional. Not so with Dr. Kermit Gosnell, prosecutors contend. The...
http://news.blogs.cnn.com/2013/03/04/doctor-accused-of-severing-babies-spines/

snippet.title: Daring, experimental surgery renowned neurosurgeon's legacy
snippet.description:
* Dr. Robert J. White performed his first neurosurgery at age 15 on a frog cadaver in high school biology class. Over the next 50 years, he operated on more than 10,000 brains, one of which accounted for the most ambitious neurological experiment in history: In the '70s, he successfully transplanted the head of one monkey to the body of another. For ...
http://www.cnn.com/2010/US/11/09/vbs.dr.white/index.html

snippet.title: Shot-by-shot testimony in Bulger trial makes jurors squirm
snippet.description:
* Jurors squirmed Monday as a Massachusetts pathologist detailed the wounds inflicted on the 19 bodies prosecutors have lain at the feet of reputed Boston mob boss James "Whitey" Bulger.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/07/15/justice/massachusetts-bulger-trial/index.html
